body_html: Also, it’s not the right way to benchmark CUDA code. You should at least have a torch.cuda.synchronize() call at the end of the time it block, and do a small warmup first (a few passes to allocate memory etc)
body_text: Also, it’s not the right way to benchmark CUDA code. You should at least have a torch.cuda.synchronize() call at the end of the time it block, and do a small warmup first (a few passes to allocate memory etc)
body: Also, it’s not the right way to benchmark CUDA code. You should at least have a torch.cuda.synchronize() call at the end of the time it block, and do a small warmup first (a few passes to allocate memory etc)
